subject: Music
subcategory: The History of Rock and Roll
title: Radiohead Rewrites the Rules
description: One-minute skill: Radiohead Rewrites the Rules.

hook.text: Radiohead released OK Computer in 1997 and made rock sound like the future.

buildup.text: The album explored alienation, technology, and modern anxiety over experimental soundscapes.

discovery.text: Kid A abandoned guitars almost entirely â€” a rock band making electronic art music.

twist.text: In 2007 they let fans pay whatever they wanted for In Rainbows â€” even nothing.

climax.text: They showed rock could evolve endlessly if artists refused to repeat themselves.

punchline.text: They didn't follow trends. They outran them.

quiz.question: What was innovative about Radiohead's In Rainbows release?
options: Fans could pay whatever they wanted, including nothing
It was only sold on vinyl
It was a soundtrack for a movie
